English:
Oh! [p]?
What are you doing in a place like this?
Chinese:
啊！ [p]！？
你在這種地方幹嘛啊？
German:
Oh! [p]?
Was machst du denn hier?

English:
Oh, wow. Working as a cyber sleuth? I don't
suppose you get to use a magnifying glass or a
voice modulator or anything like that, do you?
Chinese:
這樣啊～原來是電腦偵探的工作。
對了！你不用放大鏡或變聲器那些道具嗎？
Korean:
그렇구나~ 전뇌탐정 업무중이란 거구나
저기저기, 돋보기라든가 목소리를 바꾸는 기계 같은 건 안 써?
German:
Ui, wow. Als Cyber-Detektiv arbeiten? Darfst du
da vielleicht mit Lupe und Stimmenmodulator
zu Werke gehen? Oder wie?

English:
What? But more importantly?
What do you mean, more importantly? Gah, why do
you always gotta make everything about you?!
Chinese:
啊？這種事情不重要？
什麼嘛，什麼叫做這種事情！自私的傢伙！
Korean:
에? 그런 것보다?
뭐야, 그런 것보다라니! 엄청 제멋대로인 느낌이잖아!
German:
Wie? „Was jetzt wichtiger ist“?
Was soll das heißen, wichtiger? Bah, warum
musst du immer alles bestimmen?!

English:
Huh? A Jimiken music video?
You're investigating Jimiken?!
Chinese:
嗯……？吉米肯的MV！
[p]，你在調查吉米肯嗎？
Korean:
…뭐? 지미켄의 PV!?
[p], 지미켄에 대해 조사하고 있는 거야?
German:
Was? Ein Musikvideo von Jimiken?
Du recherchierst Jimiken?!

English:
Not that I would watch *his* video!
I mean, look at him!
Chinese:
我才不想看那種人的MV呢！
畢竟本人是那副德性耶！
Korean:
그런 녀석의 PV를 볼 리 없잖아!
실물이 그 모양인걸?
German:
Nicht, dass ich mir Videos von DEM angucken würde!
Schau ihn dir doch an!

English:
Just thinking about him makes my skin crawl!
He gets my guts churning. I get hot flashes!
Chinese:
光想到我就想吐！
而且會火冒三丈，全身發熱。
Korean:
정말, 떠올리는 것만으로도 신물이 난다고 할까
속이 뒤틀린다고 할까, 몸이 달아오른다고 할까!
German:
Mir stellen sich die Haare auf, wenn ich nur an
ihn denke! Es dreht mir den Magen um!

English: Well, he's not all bad. I mean the songs are okay.
Chinese:
嗯？因為那個……
他的歌曲本身我是不討厭啦……
Korean: 에, 그래도 뭐 그거야, 곡 자체는 싫어하지 않고…
German:
Nun ja, er ist nicht nur schlecht. Die Songs sind
ganz okay.

English:
What? Am I sick? Of course I'm not sick, silly!
I just had a heaping bowl of rice topped with egg
this morning.
Chinese:
嗯？問我有沒有哪裡不舒服？沒有呀！
今天也是一大早就吃了特大碗雞蛋拌飯……
Korean:
에? 몸에 이상은 없냐고? 그런 거 전혀 없다구!?
오늘도 아침부터 GGB(계란간장밥) 곱빼기로 먹었었고…
German:
Wie? Ob ich krank bin? Natürlich nicht!
Ich hatte erst heute früh eine große Schüssel
Reis mit Ei.

English:
What's that? Do I know Sakura?
You mean Sakura the crazy Jimiken fan?
Chinese:
什麼……？問我認不認識櫻？
你是指……吉米肯的狂熱歌迷小櫻嗎？
Korean:
…에? 사쿠라라는 애를 아냐고?
혹시… 열렬한 지미켄 팬인 사쿠랏치를 말하는 거야?
German:
Wie? Ob ich Sakura kenne?
Die Sakura, die von Jimiken ganz besessen ist?

English:
Yeah, I know her. She's a friend of mine. We were
both listening to Jimiken's songs a while ago.
Chinese:
當然認識啊！我們是朋友呀！
之前還一起聽吉米肯的歌，一起狂歡呢！
Korean:
그보다, 알고 자시고, 내 친구인걸?
얼마 전까지만 해도 지미켄의 곡으로 같이 불타올랐는걸
German:
Ja, die kenne ich. Wir sind Freundinnen. Wir haben
vor einer Weile zusammen Jimiken-Songs gehört.

English:
What happened to her?
Did she run away or something?
Chinese:
小櫻怎麼了嗎？
難道……她離家出走了？
Korean:
사쿠랏치에게 무슨 일이라도 있어?
…혹시, 가출을 했다던가?
German:
Was ist mit ihr?
Ist sie weggelaufen oder so?

English:
Well, a lot of Jimiken's fans are running away
lately, right? I heard the rumors.
Chinese:
因為最近有很多吉米肯的粉絲離家出走嘛！
我有聽到傳言。
Korean:
그게, 가출하는 지미켄 팬이 최근에 많잖아?
소문으로 들었어
German:
Nun ja, in letzter Zeit laufen viele Jimiken-Fans
von zu Hause weg, oder? Ich habe die Gerüchte
gehört.

English:
But I thought they were just rumors. If they're
true, then this is big. The cops need to put out
an ABC on these people!
Chinese:
不過應該只是單純的謠傳啦……要是真的可就不得了！
會有大批警察壓緊唷！
Korean:
그냥 소문일 뿐이라고 생각했는데… 사실이면 큰일이네
경찰이 한 일이야, 경찰이 한 일!
German:
Aber ich dachte, es wären nur Gerüchte. Wenn die
stimmen, dann ist das schlimm! Die Polizei
müsste diese Leute alle aufhängen!

English:
Wha?! An APB?
Why, what did I say? I totally said APB!
Chinese:
咦？警察壓境？
我剛剛說了什麼？人家剛剛也是這樣講的啦！
Korean:
후앗!? …경찰이 할 일?
나 방금 뭐라고 했어? 아까도 그렇게 말했는걸!
German:
Was denn?! Ach so. Ich meinte auf Postern und so.
Aushängen. Hab ich doch gesagt.

English:
But so go on.
What happened to Sakura?
Chinese:
然後呢……？
小櫻怎麼樣了？
German:
Aber erzähl weiter.
Was ist mit Sakura passiert?

English:
It's probably nothing.
I don't want the cops to have to put out an ABC.
You'll only make a fuss. I don't want to say.
Chinese:
沒什麼。
我可不想搞到警察壓緊。
要是告訴妳，妳好像會大吵大鬧，還是不講了。
Korean:
역시 아무것도 아니야
경찰이 한 일로는 만들고 싶지 않아
큰 소란을 피울 것 같아서 말하고 싶지 않아
German:
Wahrscheinlich gar nichts.
Ich will nicht, dass die Polizei sie suchen muss.
Sag ich nicht. Du führst dich nur wieder auf.

English:
Hey! What do you mean? Now I want to know!
Wait up! Hey! You! Wait!
Chinese:
等一下！什麼嘛！吊人家胃口！
等等！喂！我說！你給我等一下——！
Korean:
잠깐! 뭐야 그거! 신경 쓰이잖아!
기다려! 저기! 야! 기다려――!
German:
He! Was soll das heißen? Jetzt will ich es wissen!
Warte! He! Du! Warte!

English: Better keep asking around Nakano a bit more.
Korean: 나카노에서 좀 더 탐문 조사를 계속해 보자…
German: Ich sollte mich in Nakano weiter umhören.
